captions.text: [MUSIC PLAYING]
-Hey, everyone.

I'm Mindy from "Cute
Girls Hairstyles."

And today, I'm going to
show you a hairdo I'm
calling triple-braided tieback.

So to begin, we have
parted her hair.

You can see, I did a
middle part and then I

parted from that
middle part down

to just the very
back of her ear.
And I've done it on both sides.
I already have this side parted.

And then I've pulled the
remainder of her hair
just back into an elastic.

Now to do this, what
we're going to do

is we're going to create
three sections so that we
create three braids going back.

So we want to make the
braids as even as possible.

And because her hair on top
is thicker and a little bit

heavier than the hair
down here by her ears,

you're going to start with
a much smaller section
on the top like that.

And then you're
going to just-- I'm

just going to take an
elastic and just twist it

so it's out of my away,
but holding that hair
into place like that.

And then I'm going to go and
section off another section.

I'm going to do a little bit
bigger this section this time.

But then you want
to feel-- I can

feel I don't have enough
hair on the bottom

so I'll go back
and resection it.
That's better.
Straighten out that part line.
There we go.
OK.

So we have our six
total little sections,
three on each side of her head.

And we've got them
secured out of the way.

And we're going to start
on this bottom piece.

This is a lightweight
hairspray and it's mostly just

to help control these
baby hairs right here.
And I'm going to start a braid.

Now most people would think
you'd want a braid going back.

But in actuality, you want to
start the braid and go down.

So that's trick number one is
that when you do your braids,
just tug them down.

And I'll explain why when
we get towards the end
of the hairstyle.

But you're just
going to go ahead
and braid each section down.

And this is the only part that
might take you just a second
just getting these braids done.

They'll be some cute
when it's all done.

You can see from her outfit
that it's almost Christmas here.
And we're so excited.
Are you excited?
-Yeah.

-It's come really
fast this year.
Has it gone fast for you?
-Mhm.
Really fast.
-OK.

When you get to
the end, you only

have to go down far
enough to pull it back
to the very center of her head.
So this is plenty long.

I'm just going to secure
it with an elastic

or you could have-- if
you're doing it on yourself,
secure it with an elastic.

If you're doing it
on somebody else,
you can have them hold it.
And then we are going to poof.
And your braids are done.

I bet you guys wish you
had some of that magic.

So once you've got
them all finished up,

you're going to
take the top braid

and you're going
to pull it back.

And this is why
we braided it down

because if you braid it back,
it would end up just coming back

like this and creating
almost like a line.
And we don't want that.

So by braiding them
to the sides then

it falls gently towards
the sides of her head.
Makes it a lot prettier.

Take an elastic and go
ahead and just decide

where you want it
together and secure them.

I'm going to just
make sure I like that.
That looks good.
OK.

Then you're just going to pull
the other elastics out and let
the braid undo.
Undo.
Is that a word?
Unbraid.
Let it-- anyway.

Then you're going to
take the next ones.

And you're going to
do the same thing.

You're going to lay them back,
go down just a little bit,

and then you're going to add
this little ponytail of hair
into it as well.

So you're going to take
one of these elastics
again and secure them together.

And then place it
where you want it.
I want to tug that one.
There.
Perfect.

Go ahead and take the
elastics out of the ends
and let the braids come undone.
OK.

And last but not
least, the last layer.
Same thing.
Pick up the extra hair.

Grab one more elastic
and join them together.
And there you go.

You have a really pretty
braided hairstyle.
Pull the ends out, the elastics.
Let it unbraid.

And then if you
want to you can even

add a bow in there right at
the bottom if you'd like.

I kind of like it just
by itself because then it

adds a little bit more
accent to the braid.

And just add a little
finishing spray.
And you are finished.
Here's the final hairstyle.

And this one's a big
attention getter.
People love this one.
Do you have anything to add?
-Yeah.

Please follow us at Twitter at
Cute Girl Hair because we post

a whole bunch of photos there
that we don't post here.

-And if you're already
following us on Twitter,

make sure you pop
over and tell us
what your favorite hairstyle is.
We'll see you guys later.
-Bye.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
